episodes.title: The Moth Radio Hour: Live from the World Science Festival
episodes.author: The Moth
episodes.summary: In this hour, an astronaut gets his swimming legs; a scientist becomes a human-guinea pig; and a marine biologist shatters a glass ceiling. The stories from in this episode were recorded at a special Moth event at Lincoln Center in New York City in partnership with The World Science Festival. Hosted by Adam Gopnik with […]

episodes.title: Lydia Dubois & Louise Irving
episodes.author: The Moth
episodes.summary: This week, two stories of going off-script. Lydia Dubois shares some advice with family and friends, and Louise Irving gets acquainted with Australian wildlife. Storytellers: Lydia Dubois and Louise Irving

episodes.title: Valentine’s Day Special 2017: Kristy Hawkins, Autumn Spencer & Lucy Huber
episodes.author: The Moth
episodes.summary: In this special Valentine’s Day episode, we’re bringing you three stories from SLAMs across the country. A woman thumbs her way through the prospects of love, a mother learns what Valentine’s Day is all about, and a surprise proposal is even more unexpected than was planned. Storytellers: Kristy Hawkins, Autumn Spencer, and Lucy Huber.

episodes.title: The Moth Radio Hour: Leaving, Loving & Coming Home
episodes.author: The Moth
episodes.summary: In this episode we feature four stories about our relationship to home. Yearning for a place to call home, leaving one home in search of another and coming to find beauty and a true sense of belonging. Hosted by Meg Bowles. The Moth Radio Hour is produced by The Moth and Jay Allison of Atlantic […]

episodes.title: The Moth Radio Hour: Mr. Rogers, Bellevue, Super Markets and Coney Island
episodes.author: The Moth
episodes.summary: In this hour, a brand new doctor struggles working the night shift; a young girl has a life-threatening heart condition; a mailman joins Mister Rogers’ Neighborhood; a middle-aged man is tempted to cheat; and a child spends her birthday at Coney Island in 1957. Hosted by The Moth’s Artistic Director Catherine Burns. The Moth Radio […]

episodes.title: The Moth Radio Hour: Misfits, The MET, and a Nursing Home Switcheroo
episodes.author: The Moth
episodes.summary: An hour devoted to misfits! An awkward teenager finds his place at a museum, a child is given a sense of structure and order in life, a woman worries she isn’t “Korean enough,” and a daughter does her best to soothe her elderly mom. Hosted by The Moth’s Executive Producer, Sarah Austin Jenness. The Moth […]

episodes.title: The Moth Radio Hour: Live from Boston
episodes.author: The Moth
episodes.summary: A special Live edition of The Moth  at Wilbur Theater in Boston, Massachusetts. Hosted by Tara Clancy with additional hosting from Jay Allison. An internet scam gets emotional; a couple decide to have their second child; a patient waits for an organ  transplant; and a young Pakistani man is forever-changed by rock and roll. The […]

episodes.title: From Princeton to Prison
episodes.author: The Moth
episodes.summary: An Iranian man living in the United States is wrongly accused of a crime. Storyteller: Mahmoud Reza Banki

episodes.title: The Moth Radio Hour: Jury Duty, Walking Tests, Pepsi and NOLA
episodes.author: The Moth
episodes.summary: In this hour, a member of a punk band gets summoned to jury duty; a man with MS hopes to qualify for a medical trial; a worker’s small rebellion at the reception desk; and a father attempts to make his son into a “man’s man.” Hosted by The Moth’s Senior Producer, Jenifer Hixson. The Moth […]

episodes.title: The Moth Radio Hour: Holiday Special 2016: Unexpected Gifts of December
episodes.author: The Moth
episodes.summary: A special Holiday Hour from The Moth. The unexpected gifts of December: holiday customs, brand new traditions, flying cows, fruit, luminaries and a magical forest. Hosted by The Moth’s Executive Producer, Sarah Austin Jenness. The Moth Radio Hour is produced by The Moth and Jay Allison of Atlantic Public Media. Storytellers: Adam Ruben, Pierre Epstein, Ed McCarthy, Katie Fales, Catherine […]

episodes.title: Tracy Rowland & Carlos Kotkin
episodes.author: The Moth
episodes.summary: A woman dates a musician who has a dependent relationship with a life coach, and a man becomes a new father sooner than expected.

episodes.title: The Moth Radio Hour: LA Confidential: Honor Guard, Swing Dancing, and Data Hacking for a Date
episodes.author: The Moth
episodes.summary: In this hour, stories from Los Angeles. A divorced woman does a complete makeover on her lifestyle, an Air Force veteran describes what its like to be a member of The Honor Guard, a mourning woman looks for solace in swing dancing, a computer hacker messes with the algorithms of OKCupid. Storytellers: Carol Leifer, Adrian […]

episodes.title: The Moth Radio Hour: REM, Car Wrecks and the Circus
episodes.author: The Moth
episodes.summary: In this hour, we explore What Went Wrong: a dad gets chummy with a rock star and causes havoc, a childhood trauma shapes a super model’s outlook and The Big Apple Circus imports communist acrobats..at the height of the cold war. Storytellers: Gordon Edelstein, Padma Lakshmi, and Paul Binder.

episodes.title: Jessi Klein: Breaking Up in the Age of Google
episodes.author: The Moth
episodes.summary: A difficult break-up lures a young woman into a digital vortex.

episodes.title: Dante Jackson & Brie Mann-Hernandez
episodes.author: The Moth
episodes.summary: A middle school student comes out of his shell at his 8th grade prom and learns to dance and a young woman who is convinced that her step-grandmother must be evil is furious when all her attempts to “break her” fail.

episodes.title: Catherine Smyka & Sasha Chanoff
episodes.author: The Moth
episodes.summary: A woman tries to avoid a hard conversation with her dad but then gets stuck on a road detour and a humanitarian rescue worker is forced to decide whether he will break the rules to save more lives.

episodes.title: The Moth Radio Hour: Fathers and Children: Adventures, Joys, and Predicaments
episodes.author: The Moth
episodes.summary:
A daughter struggles with her father’s depression, a drill sergeant gets queasy, the grandson of President Harry S Truman visits Japan, a single dad teaches his kids a lesson, and a father and son must face down the same demon.

Storytellers: Karen Jones, Ed Gavagan, Clifton Truman Daniel, Nestor Gomez, and Glenn Rockowitz.

episodes.title: The Moth Radio Hour: Mets, McDonalds, and a White House Secret
episodes.author: The Moth
episodes.summary:
An author writes a spoof “kids” book about going to sleep, a family’s obsessive love of a baseball team, a teenage girl discovers her crush is in a gang, and a presidential speech writer has a secret.

Storytellers: Adam Mansbach, Marie Hershkowitz, Deborah Allen Carr, and Jon Lovett.

episodes.title: The Moth Radio Hour: Pagan Fundraisers, Blue Haired Boy, Autism and Oscar
episodes.author: The Moth
episodes.summary:
In this hour, a celebration of Moth stories and storytellers from Michigan. A woman visits a fortuneteller and is told she is cursed, a stay-at-home mother contemplates becoming a minister, the father of an autistic child describes his son’s perilous adventure and a woman takes in a history buff in need of shelter. This hour includes an interview with Patricia Wheeler, Michigan StorySLAM producer.

Storytellers: Dame Wilburn, Tina Zimmerman, Eddie Hejka Sam, and Michelle Fecteau.

episodes.title: The Moth Radio Hour: All about Moms: Babies, Bees, Concerts and Contacts
episodes.author: The Moth
episodes.summary:
A special Mother's Day edition of The Moth Radio Hour. A mother helps her daughter get her first contact lenses, an unwanted parental intervention at a school concert, a new mother in Zambia awaits test results, a life or death bee sting and a teenage mother who couldn't be happier to welcome her child to the world.

Storytellers: Chrissie Graham, Catherine Palmer, Constance Mudenda, Matthew Dicks, and Melissa Rodriguez.

episodes.title: The Moth Radio Hour: A Nobel Path
episodes.author: The Moth
episodes.summary:
A special celebration from the world of science, from the 8th grade science fair to the Nobel Prize Award Ceremony in Stockholm, Sweden.

Storytellers: Sarah Schlesinger, Robin Frankel, Deirdre Bowen, and Roald Hoffmann.

episodes.title: The Moth Radio Hour: Ghosts, Angels, and Motorcycle Rides
episodes.author: The Moth
episodes.summary:
The top editor of French Vogue rents a spooky flat in Paris; a man takes his ailing wife on a motorcycle ride; rapper Darryl "DMC" McDaniels confesses his Sarah McLachlan obsession; and a high schooler is put to the test when he comes out of the closet.

Storytellers: Joan Juliet Buck, Mike Destefano, Darryl "DMC" McDaniels, and Terrence Buckner.

episodes.title: The Moth Radio Hour: Live from Dublin
episodes.author: The Moth
episodes.summary:
A special live edition of The Moth in Dublin at Liberty Hall. A young woman must decide if she wants the surgery that might give her a few extra inches of height, a Fulbright Scholar confronts a bike thief on the streets of Dublin and a nine-year old boy enters the concentration camp Bergen Belsen.

Storytellers: Sinéad Burke, Anne Driscoll, and Tomas Reichental.

episodes.title: The Moth Radio Hour: Women in the World
episodes.author: The Moth
episodes.summary:
A special episode featuring stories from women around the world. Resilient children, computer crashes, swimming lessons, life after a house fire, standing up to bullies and accepting help from strangers.

Storytellers: Katie Smith, Catherine Palmer, Cal Wilson, Liz Allen, Kusum Thapa, and Beverly Engelman.

episodes.title: The Moth Radio Hour: Three Chefs and a Meal
episodes.author: The Moth
episodes.summary:
A special hour all about FOOD. Stories from the farm and the table; complete with celebrated chefs and presidential diners.

Storytellers: Chris Fischer, Evan Kleiman, Abhishek Shah, and Roy Choi.

episodes.title: The Moth Radio Hour: Zimbabwe, Camping, Goths and Grace
episodes.author: The Moth
episodes.summary:
A goth teenager makes an unlikely friend, social upheaval in the early days of Zimbabwe, a whiney kid on an camping trip and clergy at the scene of a crime.

Storytellers: David Crabb, Petina Gappah, Liz Allen, and Kate Braestrup.

episodes.title: Valentine’s Day Special: Aryana Rose & Matthew Dicks & Sr. Carolyn Martin
episodes.author: The Moth
episodes.summary: A special Valentine's Day episode of The Moth Podcast: A woman falls in love with a man over a decade younger than her, a man tries to keep his promise to his high school sweetheart, and a young woman has to make a difficult decision.
